suites: should not intermingle output of various commands

tests.name: Node API
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("Node API", () => nodeApi("test-task:dump {1}").then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: npm-run-all command
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {1}"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: npm-run-all command (only '--' exists)
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command (only '--' exists)", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {1}", "--"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: run-s command
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("run-s command", () => runSeq(["test-task:dump {1}"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: run-s command (only '--' exists)
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("run-s command (only '--' exists)", () => runSeq(["test-task:dump {1}", "--"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: run-p command
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("run-p command", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {1}"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: run-p command (only '--' exists)
suites: If arguments preceded by '--' are nothing, '{1}' should be empty:
tests.code: it("run-p command (only '--' exists)", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {1}", "--"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[]")));

tests.name: Node API
suites: '{1}' should be replaced by the 1st argument preceded by '--':

tests.name: npm-run-all command
suites: '{1}' should be replaced by the 1st argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {1}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st\"]")));

tests.name: run-s command
suites: '{1}' should be replaced by the 1st argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-s command", () => runSeq(["test-task:dump {1}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st\"]")));

tests.name: run-p command
suites: '{1}' should be replaced by the 1st argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-p command", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {1}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st\"]")));

tests.name: Node API
suites: '{2}' should be replaced by the 2nd argument preceded by '--':

tests.name: npm-run-all command
suites: '{2}' should be replaced by the 2nd argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {2}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"2nd\"]")));

tests.name: run-s command
suites: '{2}' should be replaced by the 2nd argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-s command", () => runSeq(["test-task:dump {2}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"2nd\"]")));

tests.name: run-p command
suites: '{2}' should be replaced by the 2nd argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-p command", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {2}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"2nd\"]")));

tests.name: Node API
suites: '{@}' should be replaced by the every argument preceded by '--':

tests.name: npm-run-all command
suites: '{@}' should be replaced by the every argument preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {@}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st\",\"2nd\"]")));

suites: '{@}' should be replaced by the every argument preceded by '--':

suites: '{*}' should be replaced by the all arguments preceded by '--':

suites: '{*}' should be replaced by the all arguments preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-s command", () => runSeq(["test-task:dump {*}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st 2nd\"]")));

tests.name: run-p command
suites: '{*}' should be replaced by the all arguments preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("run-p command", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {*}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st 2nd\"]")));

tests.name: Node API
suites: Every '{1}', '{2}', '{@}' and '{*}' should be replaced by the arguments preceded by '--':

tests.name: npm-run-all command
suites: Every '{1}', '{2}', '{@}' and '{*}' should be replaced by the arguments preceded by '--':
tests.code: it("npm-run-all command", () => runAll(["test-task:dump {1} {2} {3} {@} {*}", "--", "1st", "2nd"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"1st\",\"2nd\",\"1st\",\"2nd\",\"1st 2nd\"]")));

tests.name: Node API
suites: '{1:-foo}' should be replaced by 'foo' if arguments are nothing:

suites: '{1:-foo}' should be replaced by 'foo' if arguments are nothing:

tests.name: Node API
suites: '{1:=foo}' should be replaced by 'foo' and should affect following '{1}' if arguments are nothing:

suites: '{1:=foo}' should be replaced by 'foo' and should affect following '{1}' if arguments are nothing:

tests.name: run-p command
suites: '{1:=foo}' should be replaced by 'foo' and should affect following '{1}' if arguments are nothing:
tests.code: it("run-p command", () => runPar(["test-task:dump {1:=foo} {1}"]).then(() => assert(result() === "[\"foo\",\"foo\"]")));
